extendedIngredients.name: italian herb mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 (1.6-ounce) packet garlic herb sauce mix (recommended: Knorr)

recipes.title: Garlic and Herbed Early Peas and French Beans

winePairing.pairingText: French on the menu? Try pairing with Bordeaux, White Burgundy, and Champagne. French wine is just as diverse as French food, but you rarely go wrong with champagne. If your meal calls for a white wine, you might also try a white burgundy. For a red, try a red bordeaux blend. The Terra Blanca "ONYX" Mountain Bordeaux Blend with a 4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 103 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Terra Blanca "ONYX" Mountain Bordeaux Blend
productMatches.description: Raspberry and cherry with notes of violets lift from the glass and mingle with soft spice and toasted oak on the nose. Smooth, lush flavors of blackberry, black cherry, and cassis wrap around a core of full, yet soft, structured tannins. Cedar notes with light touches of spice fold into lingering cherry and berry flavors surrounded by a sea of rich chocolate on the palate.

recipes.instructions: Combine frozen green beans and peas in a microwave-safe bowl. Add 1 tablespoon water, cover and heat on high or 8 to 10 minutes, stirring once.                          In a large saucepan, brown chopped bacon. Remove all but 1 tablespoon of bacon fat from the pan and add onion slivers, saute until softened. Add half-and-half and cognac to pan and whisk in garlic herb sauce mix. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened.                          Drain green beans and peas. Add to pan with the sauce and stir. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.

steps.step: Combine frozen green beans and peas in a microwave-safe bowl.
Add 1 tablespoon water, cover and heat on high or 8 to 10 minutes, stirring once.
In a large saucepan, brown chopped bacon.
Remove all but 1 tablespoon of bacon fat from the pan and add onion slivers, saute until softened.
Add half-and-half and cognac to pan and whisk in garlic herb sauce mix. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened.
Add to pan with the sauce and stir. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
